column1: Smoque BBQ////The problem with Chicago is no one can do BBQ and this place has no exception. Cold
column3: chopped pork. The sauce is a mix of a typical BBQ sauce/paste with some vinegar
column4: which is just enough to drive this city wild with excitement calling it revolutionary. Do yourself a favor and buy a plane ticket with the money it would cost you to purchase a sandwich here and fly to any place in the south and figure out what real BBQ really is before ranting and raving. This place isn't diverse or anything special
column5: it's truly just a cash crop for the owners and has quite the poorest wait staff I have ever experienced
column6: it seems a bit useless to even have waiters if you have to get your own food.
